div.p: RICHARDSON Sir John (1787-1865), naturalist, was born at Dumfries on November 5, 1787, and died near Grasmere on June 5, 1865. He became a surgeon in the navy in 1807, and is known by his share in the arctic explorations of Parry and Franklin, 1819-22 and 1825-26 (see Polar Regions, vol. xix. p. 319), and in the Franklin search expedition of 1848-49 (fib., p. 321), but especially by his Fauna Boreali-Americana (1829-37, 4 vols. 4 to). He also wrote Arctic Searching Expedition (1851), and other works on the zoology of the Arctic regions. He was knighted in. 1846.
